title: Want to file chapter 7 bankruptcy. In accident without insurance now judgment against me. says will suspend license? BK help me?
question: Will the bankruptcy save me from getting my license suspended in California (DMV) if I am able to get rid of the debt in chapter 7?
answers:
Remember, BK is more than checking boxes on forms you find online. Find/consult/hire a lawyer using the Avvo feature "Find a Lawyer". Make a list of 4-5 having many 5 star reviews from satisfied clients. If you don't get a prompt call back from one, go on to the next on your list. Some of us offer a free consultation by phone or in person. Take us up on it.

Because the bankruptcy process can be handled entirely by phone, email and fax, there is no need to personally visit the lawyer’s office unless you want to. Don’t be limited by the location of the BK lawyers you select.

Yes, a chapter 7 bankruptcy will both discharge the debt and require the DMV to restore your license.

So long as there was no DUI involved, the bankruptcy discharge should attach to the debt in the judgment.

You should use an experienced bankruptcy attorney to do it right.

Also, don't be against the idea of chapter 13; there could be benefits of which you are not yet aware, and if you find out later and try to convert to 13 it may not be possible.
The short answer is Yes. Use Find a Lawyer on AVVO to find bankruptcy lawyers in your area. And get car insurance immediately or your license will remain suspended.
